00020 #ifndef _RTAI_ASM_I386_SYSCALL_H
00021 #define _RTAI_ASM_I386_SYSCALL_H
00022 
00023 #include <rtai_config.h>
00024 #include <asm/ptrace.h>
00025 
00026 /*
00027  * Some of the following macros have been adapted from glibc's syscall
00028  * mechanism implementation:
00029  * Copyright (C) 1992,1993,1995-2000,2002,2003 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
00030  * Contributed by Ulrich Drepper, <drepper@gnu.org>, August 1995.
00031  *
00032  * The following code defines an inline syscall mechanism used by
00033  * RTAI/fusion's real-time interfaces to invoke the skin module services
00034  * in kernel space.
00035  */
00036 
00037 asm (".L__X'%ebx = 1\n\t"
00038      ".L__X'%ecx = 2\n\t"
00039      ".L__X'%edx = 2\n\t"
00040      ".L__X'%eax = 3\n\t"
00041      ".L__X'%esi = 3\n\t"
00042      ".L__X'%edi = 3\n\t"
00043      ".L__X'%ebp = 3\n\t"
00044      ".L__X'%esp = 3\n\t"
00045      ".macro bpushl name reg\n\t"
00046      ".if 1 - \\name\n\t"
00047      ".if 2 - \\name\n\t"
00048      "pushl %ebx\n\t"
00049      ".else\n\t"
00050      "xchgl \\reg, %ebx\n\t"
00051      ".endif\n\t"
00052      ".endif\n\t"
00053      ".endm\n\t"
00054      ".macro bpopl name reg\n\t"
00055      ".if 1 - \\name\n\t"
00056      ".if 2 - \\name\n\t"
00057      "popl %ebx\n\t"
00058      ".else\n\t"
00059      "xchgl \\reg, %ebx\n\t"
00060      ".endif\n\t"
00061      ".endif\n\t"
00062      ".endm\n\t"
00063      ".macro bmovl name reg\n\t"
00064      ".if 1 - \\name\n\t"
00065      ".if 2 - \\name\n\t"
00066      "movl \\reg, %ebx\n\t"
00067      ".endif\n\t"
00068      ".endif\n\t"
00069      ".endm\n\t");
00070 
00071 #define XENOMAI_SYS_MUX(nr, op, args...) \
00072   ({                                                                  \
00073     unsigned resultvar;                                               \
00074     asm volatile (                                                    \
00075     LOADARGS_##nr                                                     \
00076     "movl %1, %%eax\n\t"                                              \
00077     "int $0x80\n\t"                                                   \
00078     RESTOREARGS_##nr                                                  \
00079     : "=a" (resultvar)                                                \
00080     : "i" (__xn_mux_code(0,op)) ASMFMT_##nr(args) : "memory", "cc");  \
00081     (int) resultvar; })
00082 
00083 #define XENOMAI_SKIN_MUX(nr, id, op, args...) \
00084   ({                                                                  \
00085     int muxcode = __xn_mux_code(id,op);                               \
00086     unsigned resultvar;                                               \
00087     asm volatile (                                                    \
00088     LOADARGS_##nr                                                     \
00089     "movl %1, %%eax\n\t"                                              \
00090     "int $0x80\n\t"                                                   \
00091     RESTOREARGS_##nr                                                  \
00092     : "=a" (resultvar)                                                \
00093     : "m" (muxcode) ASMFMT_##nr(args) : "memory", "cc");              \
00094     (int) resultvar; })
00095 
00096 #define LOADARGS_0
00097 #define LOADARGS_1 \
00098     "bpushl .L__X'%k2, %k2\n\t" \
00099     "bmovl .L__X'%k2, %k2\n\t"
00100 #define LOADARGS_2      LOADARGS_1
00101 #define LOADARGS_3      LOADARGS_1
00102 #define LOADARGS_4      LOADARGS_1
00103 #define LOADARGS_5      LOADARGS_1
00104 
00105 #define RESTOREARGS_0
00106 #define RESTOREARGS_1 \
00107     "bpopl .L__X'%k2, %k2\n\t"
00108 #define RESTOREARGS_2   RESTOREARGS_1
00109 #define RESTOREARGS_3   RESTOREARGS_1
00110 #define RESTOREARGS_4   RESTOREARGS_1
00111 #define RESTOREARGS_5   RESTOREARGS_1
00112 
00113 #define ASMFMT_0()
00114 #define ASMFMT_1(arg1) \
00115         , "acdSD" (arg1)
00116 #define ASMFMT_2(arg1, arg2) \
00117         , "adSD" (arg1), "c" (arg2)
00118 #define ASMFMT_3(arg1, arg2, arg3) \
00119         , "aSD" (arg1), "c" (arg2), "d" (arg3)
00120 #define ASMFMT_4(arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4) \
00121         , "aD" (arg1), "c" (arg2), "d" (arg3), "S" (arg4)
00122 #define ASMFMT_5(arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4, arg5) \
00123         , "a" (arg1), "c" (arg2), "d" (arg3), "S" (arg4), "D" (arg5)
00124 
00125 /* Register mapping for accessing syscall args. */
00126 
00127 #define __xn_reg_mux(regs)    ((regs)->orig_eax)
00128 #define __xn_reg_rval(regs)   ((regs)->eax)
00129 #define __xn_reg_arg1(regs)   ((regs)->ebx)
00130 #define __xn_reg_arg2(regs)   ((regs)->ecx)
00131 #define __xn_reg_arg3(regs)   ((regs)->edx)
00132 #define __xn_reg_arg4(regs)   ((regs)->esi)
00133 #define __xn_reg_arg5(regs)   ((regs)->edi)
00134 
00135 #define __xn_reg_mux_p(regs)        ((__xn_reg_mux(regs) & 0xffff) == __xn_sys_mux)
00136 #define __xn_mux_id(regs)           ((__xn_reg_mux(regs) >> 16) & 0xff)
00137 #define __xn_mux_op(regs)           ((__xn_reg_mux(regs) >> 24) & 0xff)
00138 #define __xn_mux_code(id,op)        ((op << 24)|((id << 16) & 0xff0000)|(__xn_sys_mux & 0xffff))
00139 
00140 #define XENOMAI_SYSCALL0(op)                XENOMAI_SYS_MUX(0,op)
00141 #define XENOMAI_SYSCALL1(op,a1)             XENOMAI_SYS_MUX(1,op,a1)
00142 #define XENOMAI_SYSCALL2(op,a1,a2)          XENOMAI_SYS_MUX(2,op,a1,a2)
00143 #define XENOMAI_SYSCALL3(op,a1,a2,a3)       XENOMAI_SYS_MUX(3,op,a1,a2,a3)
00144 #define XENOMAI_SYSCALL4(op,a1,a2,a3,a4)    XENOMAI_SYS_MUX(4,op,a1,a2,a3,a4)
00145 #define XENOMAI_SYSCALL5(op,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5) XENOMAI_SYS_MUX(5,op,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5)
00146 
00147 #define XENOMAI_SKINCALL0(id,op)                XENOMAI_SKIN_MUX(0,id,op)
00148 #define XENOMAI_SKINCALL1(id,op,a1)             XENOMAI_SKIN_MUX(1,id,op,a1)
00149 #define XENOMAI_SKINCALL2(id,op,a1,a2)          XENOMAI_SKIN_MUX(2,id,op,a1,a2)
00150 #define XENOMAI_SKINCALL3(id,op,a1,a2,a3)       XENOMAI_SKIN_MUX(3,id,op,a1,a2,a3)
00151 #define XENOMAI_SKINCALL4(id,op,a1,a2,a3,a4)    XENOMAI_SKIN_MUX(4,id,op,a1,a2,a3,a4)
00152 #define XENOMAI_SKINCALL5(id,op,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5) XENOMAI_SKIN_MUX(5,id,op,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5)
00153 
00154 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00155 
00156 #include <linux/errno.h>
00157 #include <asm/uaccess.h>
00158 
00159 /* Our own set of copy-to/from-user macros which must bypass
00160    might_sleep() checks. The caller cannot fault and is expected to
00161    have checked for bad range before using the copy macros, so we
00162    should not have to care about the result. The apparently
00163    preposterous do-while bracketing just helps silencing GCC's
00164    "warn_unused_result" attribute on the related kernel macros. */
00165 #define __xn_copy_from_user(task,dstP,srcP,n)  \
00166 do { \
00167     if (__copy_from_user_inatomic(dstP,srcP,n)) \
00168         ; \
00169 } while(0)
00170 #define __xn_copy_to_user(task,dstP,srcP,n)  \
00171 do { \
00172     if (__copy_to_user_inatomic(dstP,srcP,n)) \
00173         ; \
00174 } while(0)
00175 #define __xn_put_user(task,src,dstP)           __put_user(src,dstP)
00176 #define __xn_get_user(task,dst,srcP)           __get_user(dst,srcP)
00177 
00178 #define __xn_range_ok(task,addr,size) ({ \
00179         unsigned long flag,sum; \
00180         asm("addl %3,%1 ; sbbl %0,%0; cmpl %1,%4; sbbl $0,%0" \
00181                 :"=&r" (flag), "=r" (sum) \
00182                 :"1" (addr),"g" ((int)(size)),"g" ((task)->thread_info->addr_limit.seg)); \
00183         flag; })
00184 
00185 /* WP bit must work for using the shadow support, so we only need
00186    trivial range checking here. */
00187 #define __xn_access_ok(task,type,addr,size)    (__xn_range_ok(task,addr,size) == 0)
00188 
00189 /* Purposedly used inlines and not macros for the following routines
00190    so that we don't risk spurious side-effects on the value arg. */
00191 
00192 static inline void __xn_success_return(struct pt_regs *regs, int v) {
00193     __xn_reg_rval(regs) = v;
00194 }
00195 
00196 static inline void __xn_error_return(struct pt_regs *regs, int v) {
00197     __xn_reg_rval(regs) = v;
00198 }
00199 
00200 static inline void __xn_status_return(struct pt_regs *regs, int v) {
00201     __xn_reg_rval(regs) = v;
00202 }
00203 
00204 static inline int __xn_interrupted_p(struct pt_regs *regs) {
00205     return __xn_reg_rval(regs) == -EINTR;
00206 }
00207 
00208 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00209 
00210 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_TSC
00211 
00212 #define CONFIG_RTAI_HW_DIRECT_TSC 1
00213 
00214 static inline unsigned long long __xn_rdtsc (void)
00215 
00216 {
00217     unsigned long long t;
00218     __asm__ __volatile__( "rdtsc" : "=A" (t));
00219     return t;
00220 }
00221 
00222 #endif  /* CONFIG_X86_TSC */
00223 
00224 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00225 
00226 #endif /* !_RTAI_ASM_I386_SYSCALL_H */
